definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: At present, homophonic transliteration has become a fashion in the translation of trademarks.
sentences.chinese: 时下，谐音译在商标翻译中成为一种时髦。
“五日元”在日语里谐音“有缘份”。

sentences.english: Because there is homophonic , now often confused.
sentences.chinese: 因为两者是谐音，时下往往混淆。
中文“河蟹”与“和谐”是谐音。

sentences.english: Hoist and bats and "f" for the homophonic, so the name for blessing.
sentences.chinese: 葫芦和蝙蝠与“福”为谐音，故命名为祝福。

sentences.english: This historical phenomenon of the association with the Chinese homonym.
sentences.chinese: 这一历史现象与汉语谐音联想有关。

sentences.english: The ribbons knot together is homophonic to auspicious which means "everything goes well".
sentences.chinese: 绶带挽结的“结”与“吉”谐音，代表着吉祥如意。

sentences.english: The homophonic of five FU WA name add exactly" Peking is welcome you".
sentences.chinese: 五个福娃名字的谐音加起来正是“北京欢迎您”。

sentences.english: And in Chinese, the number eight is a homophone for the word for getting rich.
sentences.chinese: 而在中国，数字“8”与“发”谐音。

sentences.english: Homophony is a phenomenon widely existed in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 谐音是汉语里一种普遍存在的语言现象。

sentences.english: Purported Chinese curse is in fact the harmonics.
sentences.chinese: 其本意其实是中国国骂的谐音。

sentences.english: Includes alliteration, harmonics, onomatopoetic, parallelism, symmetry and parables, etc.
sentences.chinese: 包括头韵，谐音，拟声，排比，对称和比喻等。

definition: moral (of a story)/lesson to be learned/implication/message/import/metaphorical meaning
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
to name/to christen/to take a name
original form of a Chinese character
name (of a person or thing)/CL:個|个[ge4]
pet name for a child/childhood name
meaning (of foreign expression)/translation of the meaning (as opposed to literal translation 直譯|直译)/paraphrase/free translation
alternative name/to refer to sth by another name/antonomasia
